data.title: All State Football Teams
data.meta_description: Click here for the Associated Press All-State football teams.Â  Monday: 1A, Tuesday: 2A, Wednesday: 3A, Thursday: 4A, Friday: 5A
data.text:
FIRST-TEAM OFFENSE:

OFFENSIVE LINE (3 tied):

TRAY ALLEN, South Grand Prairie, Sr., 6-4, 305. Team averaged 377.5 yards, 35.6 ppg.

MARIO BENAVIDES, Los Fresnos, Jr., 6-4, 275. 74 pancakes, graded 91 percent, 1 sack allowed.

KEGAN CAREY, Abilene, Sr., 6-1, 285. 2005 all-state pick.

BLAKE EMERT, Garland Sachse, Sr., 6-5, 275. Committed to Texas Tech.

ROBERT HILL, Southlake Carroll, Sr., 6-4, 275. Offense averaged 49.6 points, 552 ypg.

ALBERT LOZANO, McAllen Memorial, Sr., 6-3, 250. 95 pancakes; offense averaged 469 ypg, 45 ppg.

MANAAKI VAITAI, Euless Trinity, Sr., 6-3, 299. 264 pancakes; offense rushed for 276 ypg.

ENDS/RECEIVERS:

BREECE JOHNSON, Colleyville Heritage, Sr., 6-2, 175. 66 catches, 1,054 yards, 14 TDs.

EVAN WALKER, Colleyville Heritage, Sr., 5-10, 190. 80 catches, 1,236 yards, 11 TDs.

QUARTERBACK:

RILEY DODGE, Southlake Carroll, Jr., 6-0, 180. 2,642 yards, 36 TDs. Ran for 1,019 yards, 12 TDs.

RUNNING BACKS:

SAM McGUFFIE, Cypress Fairbanks, Jr., 5-10, 175. 2,303 yards, 32 TDs.

BRADLEY STEPHENS, McAllen Memorial, Sr., 5-11, 200. 1,875 yards, 23 TDs; committed to Texas A&M.

DEVIN THOMAS, SA Madison, Jr., 5-11, 180. 1,889 yards, 23 TDs.

KICKER:
